data.name: AlertFisrtQuestion
data.value:
Why [Refresh] by me and not Auto? We are trying to save your Battery!
Repeated auto calls to GPS can drain your battery rather fast.
We want YOU in control of calls to GPS. hurray --- BATTERY SAVED.

data.name: AlertNoHospitalYet
data.value: No GPS location data yet. (1) Assure that you have Internet Access (2) Pressing [ Start / Refresh ] to reload Location data.

data.name: AlertNoInternet
data.value:
Could not 'get' GPS 1) Current Internet acceess restricted (like 'free' access) 2) No Internet / Wi-Fi access
A) Check 'Settings', 'Connections' B) Check Toolbar Menus (three-dots) for 'Tips', 'Troubleshooting'

data.name: AlertNoLatLong
data.value: No data, even after a minute? 1) First, assure Internet Conectivity Check out this app's Toolbar menus (Upper right, three dots) 2) Assure that "Location" is on: * Tap on Phone [Settings], * next Tap on [Connections] * check \"Locations\" (must be ON)

data.name: AlertPermissionNeeded
data.value:
Device 'Location' required, and Permission needed:
the 'Location' is used to get your position, and compare against a hospital position.
See top Toolbar menu, "Tips" for more...

data.name: BaseHowItWorksTxt2
data.value:
Start the application. Tap [Start / Refresh ]
(1) Your geolocation is generated.
(2) Hospital database is prepared
(3) Part of the database keyed to your location will now move into the app.
(4) A particular Hospital selected.
(5) A call goes out to Google to formulate, and show Hospital Details

data.name: BaseHowItWorksTxt5Safe
data.value:
Good Question?
Our Promise: Our app will:
** asked for permissions before we use certain functions
** run geo scans in concise bursts, and save battery life
** run a brief, targeted info-request blast to Google when a selected Hospital (name) needs updates, and save battery life

data.name: BaseHowItWorksWhatisItText
data.value:
This application will:
* list the nearest Hospital(s), show distance, give many details
** or gives you a list of all Hospital(s) in 100 miles surrounding (or 1st 100) *** lets you select a Hospital from the sorted list and will show a Google-generated page with many hospital related details, including:
(a) hospitals address, phone numbers
(b) Driving Direction, web-site
(c) medical and health capabilities
(d) presence of an Emergency Department
(e) RATING

data.name: BaseHowItWorksWhatText
data.value:
This application will:
* list the nearest Hospital(s), show distance, give many details
** or gives you a list of all Hospital(s) in 100 miles surrounding (or 1st 100) *** lets you select a Hospital from the sorted list and will show a Google-generated page with many hospital related details, including:

data.name: BaseListGuideSorting
data.value:
You can SORT the list on all columns
- Tap 'Miles', 'Beds', 'Name' - column will sort up/down - an arrow to the right will tell direction

data.name: BaseListGuideWhatDetails
data.value:
This application will:
* list the nearest Hospital (name), show distance
** or gives you a list of all Hospital (names) in 100 miles surrounding (or 1st 100)
Select a Hospital (name) from a list, and a Google-generated page will show many details about the selected Hospital:
(a) hospitals address, phone numbers
(b) Driving Direction, web-site
(c) medical and health capabilities
(d) presence of an Emergency Department
(e) RATING

data.name: BaseListGuideWhatDetailsHD
data.value: (2) What are the Details I see?

data.name: BaseShareText
data.value: This seems to be a very useful app. It gives you a list of hospitals centered around your current location. The listed hospitals have a lot of details, and yes, they are RATED. Take a look at [https://www.cnginternetsoftware.com/smart_phone_software ]

data.name: BaseTipsInstantSilence
data.value:
'Instant Silence' is an option where you can NOW turn this buzzing off, even for a length of time
(1) Bring up 'Starter - Phone Silence Page, i.e. 1st page (2) Select 'Silent on', select 'til when if needed -- done; silent 'til: -- press 'now Off', or -- duration runs out.

data.name: BaseTipsLocation
data.value:
MY ADDRESS IS WRONG, WHY? GPS receivers use signals from satellites and sender on the ground to get a 'fix' on your location. That information is merged (overlayed) on maps to get a 'named' address. Two challenges: (1) satelite and ground equipment signals can, and will, be interfered with, and (2) maps go out of date. So, with these bottlenecks, an 'accurate' address is at time off by as much as 60 feet.
A Tip: Assure that the "High accuracy" setting is on. Go to 'Settings', 'Connections', 'Locations', and set "High accuracy" on.

data.name: BaseTipsPermissions
data.value:
Setting User Access Permissions can be done in two ways:
(1) via standard in-program message panels,
(2) via 'outside' general app Settings options. Start by finding and tapping the [ Settings ] icon Next:
(a) tap "Apps," tap "All" or "Enabled" option (b) scroll, find and tap on "Phone Silence Area," (c) scroll, and find "Permissions," set as required

data.name: BaseTipsSmallArea
data.value:
If this app needs to 'work' in areas suspected of transmission interferences, it can use some help.
(1) Internet Connection ON, able to reach Googles Location Services (2) Turn 'high accuracy localization mode' on (see next subject) (3) Turn Wi-Fi (Wi-Fi Scanning) on. Not having to relay just on cell info. (4) Turn GPS on (Warning, heavy battery use).

data.name: BPrivacyBody1
data.value: We collect NO personal information. We collect NO payment information. We collect NO Social Media Login Data. We collect NO automatic data, such as IP addresses or device characteristics. We collect NO private, personal information from other sources.

data.name: BPrivacyBody10
data.value: As a resident of California, you are covered by California Civil Code Section 1798.83, known as the "Shine The Light" law. Your Rights include the request, free, once a year, of specific Information about personal Information if any collected. Please contact us via email at service@CNGInternetSoftware.com regarding CA 1798.83

data.name: BPrivacyBody11
data.value: Yes, whenever it is necessary to stay legal. An updated "Revised" date will indicate the updated version.

data.name: BPrivacyBody12
data.value: Any questions, any comments, please email us at Service@CNGInternetSoftware.com.

data.name: BPrivacyBody2
data.value: We are not processing any personal, private information at all

data.name: BPrivacyBody8
data.value: Although we do not collect any information, you may contact us at service@CNGInternetSoftware.com regarding any discussion regarding privacy and personal data.

data.name: BPrivacyBody9
data.value: Do-Not-Track (DNT) technology for mobile applications is not yet uniformly implemented. We currently do not recognize, collect, and process and respond to DNT.

data.name: BPrivacyMainBody
data.value: Thank you downloading our mobile software. We will protect your Personal Information and your right to privacy. Any questions regarding your Personal Information, please contact us at service@CNGInternetSoftware.com This document will describe our privacy policy. We will explain to you what Information, if any, we collect, how it is (if received) used, and what your rights are. In case you do not agree with our Privacy Policy, please stop using this application. This privacy policy applies to all collected Information as well as related services.

data.value: By Location. Any Place, Any Room.

data.value: are used to define a Silent Area.

data.name: FindHLabelAllOther
data.value: All other Hospitals / ER's, from your location, either: 1 - First 100 count 2 - or, First 100 miles

data.name: ListRuleHeader
data.value: Listing. To manage, TAP on a Profile.

data.name: MainPageDeviceLocationGranted
data.value: [Phone Silent Area] runs now normal, i.e. with locations, Profiles

data.name: MainPageFastExplanation
data.value:
This is the distance, in miles, from your current location to the nearest Profile.
Why is that important? AI (Artificial Intelligence) at work. If the phone is miles and miles from the most adjacent Profile, the App goes to sleep, waking up in a time when we are way closer.
So? SAVING BATTERY POWER. No draining of battery while 'looking' for that Profile with a radius of 100ft, and we are 10 miles away.
Did I say AI at work?
